
This vignette demonstrates re-creating table 1 from the Bretz/Maurer/Hommel Stat Med paper from 2011 using graphicalMCP. Here is the target output

![Table 1 from the 2011 Statistics in Medicine paper](img/table_1.png)

```{r}
eps <- .0001

params <- rbind(
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,  .5, 0, 0, 0, 0),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,  .5, 3, 0, 0, 0),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,  .5, 3, 0, 3, 0),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,  .5, 3, 0, 3, 3),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,  .5, 2, 0, 3, 3),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,  .5, 1, 0, 3, 3),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,  .5, 3, 3, 0, 0),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,  .5, 3, 3, 2, 2),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5,   0, 3, 3, 2, 2),
  c(.0125, .0125,    .5,    .5, .99, 3, 3, 2, 2),
  c(.0125, .0125, 1-eps, 1-eps,  .5, 3, 0, 3, 0),
  c( .025,     0,     0,     0,  .5, 3, 0, 3, 0),
  c( .025,     0,     0,     0,  .5, 0, 3, 3, 0)
)

colnames(params) <- c(al_1)
```
